result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael V. Erickson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Payment of $100 fine + costs + service fees + DNA Surcharge= Payment to be worked out with agent.

No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances illegal in WI today, without a valid Rx. No THC, Methadone, or Suboxone for any reason. No entrance into any bars, taverns, or liquor stores whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. May dine at an establishment that serves alcohol, but may not sit at the bar any anyone sitting at the table may not have alcohol. No contact with T.D. No contact with known drug users or sellers, except in a treatment setting and only with prior agent approval. May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.

Any medications, including those prescribed, may only be taken with prior agent approval. Must take any medications prescribed for mental health or substance abuse. AODA and follow through. Mental health evaluation and follow through. Completion of all assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent. Obtain and maintain full time employment. May reside at sister's residence in Louisiana, only with approval of the agent. DNA Sample Due: 7-15-2022.

timeConds.notes: 109 days conditional jail time= credit for 109 days time served.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael V. Erickson

records.addlTxt:
8:52 AM Defendant Michael V. Erickson in court, in custody.  Attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Brad Hansen in court for Michael V. Erickson. 
Court calls case.
Copy of PSI.
Atty Hansen heard on corrections to PSI.
DA heard on corrections to PSI.
DA heard on sentencing recommendation.
Atty Hansen heard on sentencing.
Deft heard.
Court heard on factors.
Court imposed and stayed on Count 1:
18 months initial confinement, 2 years extended supervision, consecutive to any other sentence, and places Deft on probation for 3 years.
Not eligible for CIP or SAP.
Conditions of probation:
109 days conditional jail.
Credit for 109 days time served.
Payment of $100 fine + costs + service fees + DNA surcharge = $ - payment to be worked out with agent.
No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances illegal in WI today, without a valid prescription.
Any medications, including those prescribed, may only be taken with prior agent approval.
Must take any medications prescribed for mental health or substance abuse.
No THC, Methadone, or Suboxone for any reason.
No entrance into any bars or taverns whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
May dine at an establishment that serves alcohol, but may not sit at the bar, and anyone sitting at the table may not have alcohol.
No contact with T.D.
No contact with known drug users or sellers, except in a treatment setting, and only with prior agent approval.
AODA and follow through.
Mental health evaluation and follow through.
Completion of all assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent.
Obtain and maintain full time employment.
May reside at sister's residence in Louisiana, only with the approval of the agent.
No firearms.
May not vote or serve on jury until civil rights are restored.
DNA Sample due 07-15-22.
Appeal rights.
9:31 AM
Sentencing hearing on July 15, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Atty Hansen provides plea form.

Atty Hansen agrees.
Court arraigns Deft on Count 1.
Deft enters a plea of no contest.
Non-citizen advisory.
No firearms.
May not vote or serve on jury until civil rights are restored.

Constitutional rights.
Elements of offense.
Read-ins.
Deft understands.
Atty Hansen satisfied.
Factual basis.

Court dismisses and reads-in Counts 2, 3, and 4.
Court order presentence investigation be completed.  Agent to provide report to court at least 10 days prior to sentencing.
